intro: Hieracium heterospermum subsp. subhirsutum, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy, lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats, often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Its subspecies name, subhirsutum, refers to its distinctive hairy appearance, particularly on the stems and leaves.
